thread.title: Florida firefighters join rescue efforts in Texas amid severe flooding

author: @wcjb20
title: Florida firefighters join rescue efforts in Texas amid severe flooding
text:
Florida firefighters join rescue efforts in Texas amid severe flooding
GAINESVILLE, Fla. (WCJB) - Members of North Central Florida Fire Rescue are currently assisting with rescue efforts in Texas, following severe flooding.
Florida Governor Ron DeSantis authorized the deployment of six members from Florida Task Force Eight, including teams from Gainesville, Ocala, and Marion County Fire Rescue.
Among the team is District Chief Devin Chapman from Gainesville Fire Rescue.
DeSantis emphasized the state’s search and rescue capabilities.
“Florida has a robust search and rescue system where we take care of a lot of our own emergencies, we want to be on the ground immediately for our citizens and be able to take care of them,” DeSantis said. “But also, when we can, we will reach out to other communities and assist them, and we have a history of doing that.”
This week, Task Force Eight was dispatched to areas where flash floods have submerged roadways and overwhelmed drainage systems.
